So German crusaders, in particular, started to adopt another practice: boiling the flesh off the bones (in water or wine), and bringing the bones back home. This became known as "mos Teutonicus", or "the German custom".
Apparently high-ranking crusaders didn't hold with the idea of being buried in non-Christian lands, but neither was it practical for their bodies to be brought home intact.
